mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: A "most calamitous year" for crops because of drought and the blockade; complains about the state of higher education in Virginia, including the College of William & Mary; The professors, who are "a parcel of pettifogging academics," "starve out real science, which is accordingly totally extinct in this state."
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1813 November 9, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to W[illiam] Short, n.p.
